{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[306]] &ndash; [[Martyrdom]] of [[Saint Demetrius of Thessaloniki]]
*[[1341]] &ndash; The [[Byzantine civil war of 1341–1347]] formally begins with the proclamation of [[John VI Kantakouzenos]] as [[Byzantine Emperor]] at [[Didymoteicho]].
*[[1597]] &ndash; [[Imjin War]]: Admiral [[Yi Sun-sin]] routs the Japanese Navy of 300 ships with only 13 ships at the [[Battle of Myeongnyang]].
*[[1640]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Ripon]] is signed, restoring peace between [[Covenanter|Scotland]] and [[Charles I of England]].
*[[1689]] &ndash;  [[General Enea Silvio Piccolomini|General Piccolomini]] of Austria [[Fire of Skopje 1689|burns down Skopje]] to prevent the spread of [[cholera]]. He died of cholera himself soon after.
*[[1774]] &ndash; The first [[Continental Congress]] adjourns in [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; King [[George III of Great Britain]] goes before Parliament to declare the American colonies in rebellion, and authorized a military response to quell the [[American Revolution]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Benjamin Franklin]] departs from America for [[France]] on a mission to seek French support for the [[American Revolution]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; The [[French Directory]], a five-man revolutionary government, is created.
*[[1811]] &ndash; The [[Argentine government]] declare the freedom of expression for the press by decree.
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: A combined force of British regulars, [[Canada|Canadian]] militia, and [[Mohawk nation|Mohawk]]s defeat the [[United States|Americans]] in the [[Battle of Chateauguay]].
*[[1825]] &ndash; The [[Erie Canal]] opens &ndash; passage from [[Albany, New York]] to [[Lake Erie]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; The [[Royal Charter (ship)|Royal Charter]] is wrecked on the coast of [[Anglesey]], north [[Wales]] with 459 dead.
*[[1860]] &ndash; Meeting of [[Teano]]. [[Giuseppe Garibaldi]], conqueror of the [[Kingdom of Two Sicilies]], gives it to King [[Victor Emmanuel II of Italy]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; The [[Pony Express]] officially ceases operations.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[The Football Association]], the oldest [[Association football|football]] association in the world, is formed in [[London]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; The [[Gunfight at the O.K. Corral]] takes place at [[Tombstone, Arizona]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Norway]] becomes independent from [[Sweden]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Itō Hirobumi]], four time Prime Minister of Japan (the 1st, 5th, 7th and 10th) and [[Resident-General of Korea]], is assassinated by [[Ahn Jung-geun]] at the [[Harbin]] train station in [[Manchuria]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: The Ottoman occupied city of [[Thessaloniki]], is liberated and unified with [[Greece]] on the [[feast day]] of its [[patron Saint]] [[Saint Demetrius|Demetrius]]. On the same day, [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] troops captured [[Skopje]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Caporetto]]; [[Italy]] suffers a catastrophic defeat at the forces of [[Austria-Hungary]] and [[Germany]]. The young unknown [[Oberleutnant]] [[Erwin Rommel]] captures Mount [[Matajur]] with only 100 Germans against a force of over 7000 Italians.
*  1917   &ndash; World War I: [[Brazil]] [[Brazil during World War I|declares war]] on the [[Central Powers]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Erich Ludendorff]], quartermaster-general of the [[German Army (German Empire)|Imperial German Army]], is dismissed by [[Kaiser]] [[William II, German Emperor|Wilhelm II]] of [[Germany]] for refusing to cooperate in peace negotiations.
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Chicago Theatre]] opens.
*[[1936]] &ndash; The first [[electric generator]] at [[Hoover Dam]] goes into full operation.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The [[P-51 Mustang]] makes its maiden flight.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In the [[Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands]] during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]], one U.S. aircraft carrier, [[USS Hornet (CV-8)|''Hornet'']], is sunk and another aircraft carrier, [[USS Enterprise (CV-6)|''Enterprise'']], is heavily damaged, while two Japanese carriers and one cruiser are heavily damaged.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: First flight of the [[Dornier Flugzeugwerke|Dornier]] [[Dornier Do 335|Do 335]] "Pfeil".
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] ends with an overwhelming American victory.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Maharaja]] of [[Kashmir and Jammu (princely state)|Kashmir and Jammu]] agrees to allow his kingdom to join [[India]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; After the last [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] troops have left the country and following the provisions of the [[Austrian Independence Treaty]], Austria declares [[neutral country|permanent neutrality]].
*  1955   &ndash; [[Ngo Dinh Diem|Ngô Đình Diệm]] declares himself Premier of [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Pan American World Airways|Pan American Airways]] makes the first commercial flight of the [[Boeing 707]] from [[New York City]] to [[Paris, France]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Eric Edgar Cooke]] becomes last person in [[Western Australia]] to be executed.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi]] [[coronation|crowns]] himself Emperor of Iran and then crowns his wife [[Farah Pahlavi|Farah]] Empress of Iran.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[cosmonaut]] [[Georgy Beregovoy]] pilots [[Soyuz 3]] into space for a four-day mission.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Ali Maow Maalin]], the last natural case of [[smallpox]], develops rash in Merca district, [[Somalia]]. The [[World Health Organization]] and the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] consider this date the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox, the most spectacular success of [[vaccination]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Park Chung-hee]], [[President of South Korea]] is [[Park Chung-hee assassination|assassinated]] by [[Korean Central Intelligence Agency]] head [[Kim Jae-kyu]]. [[Choi Kyu-ha]] becomes the acting President; Kim is executed the following [[May]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; "[[Baby Fae]]" receives a [[heart transplant]] from a [[baboon]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The [[Australian government]] returns ownership of [[Uluru]] to the local [[Pitjantjatjara people|Pitjantjatjara]] Aborigines.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Charlottetown Accord]] fails to win majority support in a [[Canada]] wide [[referendum]].
*  1992   &ndash; The [[London Ambulance Service]] is thrown into chaos after the implementation of a new [[Computer-assisted dispatch|CAD]], or Computer Aided Dispatch, system which failed.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Jordan]] and [[Israel]] sign a peace treaty
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Israeli-Palestinian Conflict]]: [[Mossad]] agents assassinate [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] leader [[Fathi Shikaki]] in his hotel in [[Malta]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[United Kingdom|Britain's]] [[House of Lords]] votes to end the right of [[hereditary peer]]s to vote in Britain's upper chamber of [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|Parliament]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Laurent Gbagbo]] takes over as president of [[Côte d'Ivoire]] following a popular uprising against President [[Robert Guéï]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[United States]] passes the [[USA PATRIOT Act]] into law.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Moscow Theatre Siege]]: Approximately 50 [[Chechnya|Chechen]] terrorists and 150 hostages die when [[Russia]]n [[Spetsnaz]] storm a theater building in [[Moscow]], which had been occupied by the terrorists during a musical performance three days before.
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Cedar Fire]], the second-largest fire in [[California]] history, kills 15 people, consumes {{convert|250,000|acre|km2}}, and destroys 2,200 homes around [[San Diego]].
